thread.section_title: Lookupfare Reviews | Customer Service Reviews of Lookupfare | lookupfare.com
thread.title: Tony Brookshire

author: Tony Brookshire
title: Tony Brookshire
text:
I have received a phone call from one of their managers (Roger Williams) within 15 minutes of my original (not so nice) review. He was very apologetic for the difficult time I had in reaching them. He explained that they were having some technical difficulties and that is causing them quite a few issues. He has already resolved the reason that I was trying to reach them, so I have re-evaluated my rating and bumped it up to a 4 because of his personal attention to my issue. That is the kind of customer service that will win them another shot at my business in the future.
I needed to change the date of the flight (that I had purchased travel insurance for), but could not get in touch with them by phone after many attempts. All I kept getting was music, no prerecorded message saying please hold, or anything. So, I went on their website and was excited to find a chat option. However, when I submitted my chat request, I received a message that all operators were busy and would be with me shortly. Then I noticed I was number 36 in line. Well, 15 minutes later I was #35 and now 30 minutes later, I'm still #35!
So, I decided to reach out to them by their 24/7 email support. Still absolutely no response.
I can guarantee you one thing, I will never use this company again!
by the way, it is now 45 minutes since I started the chat request and I am still #35! At this rate, it will be 3 weeks before I get to talk to someone.
